original_title: FDA warns against eating certain shrimp sold at Walmart amid investigation into radioactive contamination | CNN
article_summary: The US Food and Drug Administration has advised against consuming certain 2-pound bags of frozen raw shrimp from Walmart, due to potential radioactive contamination and unsanitary conditions from the Indonesian supplier BMS Foods. The affected shrimp, labeled as Great Value white vannamei shrimp, were distributed to Walmart stores in 13 states and have a best-by date of March 15, 2027. Walmart has recalled the product, and an investigation is ongoing in conjunction with Indonesian seafood regulatory authorities.</s>
